name: Residenza Cellini

reviews.text: What a fabulous hotel! A quiet haven. Staff went out of their way to help with advice on where to go and where to eat. We had a junior suite which was simply wonderful.
reviews.title: Residenza Cellini - Fabulous!
Best hotel in Rome
reviews.text: Will definitely stay here again!

I have stayed in Rome on two other occasions and was sorry I hadn't heard of the Cellini before this trip. We had wonderful rooms so conveniently located from the main train station. I wouldn't have thought that staying near the station would find us such a lovely hotel.
reviews.title: Highly Recommend this Stunning Hotel!
Beautiful and great location.
reviews.text: There are only about 6 rooms, and each one is decorated just exquisitely, clean, roomy and cheerful. Our bathroom had a window too. There is a charming little breakfast room with a very nice elderly gentleman who assists you with your coffee and the buffet is quite nice.

reviews.title: An excellent hotel
reviews.text: The staff recommended wonderful places to eat in the neighborhood which I highly recommend, the Giglio across from the Opera.
It’s taken a while for me to write this up – and I apologize profusely for that to the De Paolis family (who own and run the hotel) because my stay at Residenza Cellini was absolutely marvelous.
reviews.title: Absolutely Wonderful
Surpassed all expectations
reviews.text: The Residenza Cellini really is what one imagines it would be like to be staying at a mansion in town. There’s a real sense of the personal and the luxurious. The De Paolis family are all so kind, so helpful, so eager to be sure you are well taken care of and able to enjoy visiting the city. I cannot thank them enough, especially Barbara for all the thoughtfulness and assitance.

I was in Rome with my niece to celebrate her 16th birthday. She actually turned 16 while we were there and Babara De Paolis suggested a little surprise. The evening of Allie's birthday, before we left for dinner, Barbara appeared at the door with champagne! (At 16 it’s legal to drink in Italy). It was so kind of Barbara to do that and Allie was thrilled to be treated in such a grown-up way.
reviews.title: Residenza Cellini is top notch

reviews.text: Our room was one of the smaller ones yet very comfortable, with twin beds, desk, chairs, table, armoire and windows. The bathroom (as everything else) was immaculate, totally modern and beautiful and had a big window (but done in such a way that there was no privacy problem).
reviews.title: Incredible Service!

reviews.text: One more thing, I don’t know if anyone else has mentioned this but Residenze Cellini makes the best capuccino I have ever tasted. It will spoil you forever.
reviews.title: Highly recommend the Residenza Cellini
Great Location/Friendly Staff
reviews.text: My daughter, niece and I stayed at this hote April 22 -25, 2006. I booked my reservations after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. This hotel was a great value in Rome in a very convenient location. We walked from Termini train station with our luggage. It took us about ten minuites and a taxi wanted to charges us 30,00 Euro. There is a subway station within 5 minuites from the hotel. You can walk to about everything and when it is late at night and you are tired of walking and the subway is closed you can look for any bus with Termini on it and get back to this hotel very quickly. There is plenty of shopping and resturants nearby. We could not have asked for a better location. This hotel is located on a side street and is very quiet.

reviews.title: Staying here is like staying with local friends in Rome
reviews.text: The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. They confirmed our flights, gave us great directions and maps, and recommended excellent resturants. Our room was lovely, and large enough to accomodate all three of us. If I ever go back to Rome I will stay at this hotel.

We stayed at the RC for 4 nights during the week of April 17. We found the room to be very comfortable for 3 people. The staff was very helpful with all requests, especially arranging reservations for museums and attractions in advance of our visit. We did not wait in any lines in Rome because of their helpful recommendations and advance preparation. It was as if we were staying in the home of good friends instead of a hotel. My son said it best - "they made me feel special". Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Very Nice
Enjoyed this graceful,helpful,peaceful place
reviews.text: Just returned from a trip to Italy and after staying in 4 different hotels I would probably rate this one 4/5. To be honest I was not completely impressed with the furniture and decor of the room at first. It looked a little dated but was fine. It surprised me how small the place was (one floor in an office type building). It was close to the train which was good, but a good walk to the popular sites. It also is confusing to get around Rome and we got turned around easily (could be just me). The staff was beyond helpful and for whatever was lacking they made up for. The bathroom was clean and modern and the breakfast was also good. Staff was very good at making calls for taxis or giving directions. The staff definitely makes this place. Another plus, at night it is almost silent! We slept with our window open and even though there are things nearby, I didn't hear anything. I learned this is a big plus in Florence when I stayed at the LOUD Globus Hotel. I will say that I heard our neighbors in the morning through the walls quite easily, but no big deal. Also be prepared for a small very old elevator... kind of fun once we were used to it.
In summary
reviews.title: An oasis of calm in a busy City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked at the Cellini after reading reviews by fellow Trip Advisors. We were not disappointed.
reviews.title: Best B & B in Europe?

likes.disliked: — The street via Modena is a back street and is a bit off putting

reviews.title: Very nice!
reviews.text: At first it is a little unusual as the property is actually on the 3rd floor of 5 via Modena. It is accessed via the large door on the street level. The street is a 'back street' which runs parallel with Via National' and the street isn’t the nicest you've ever seen, but it is down town in a 2000 year old city! You ring up to Cellini via an intercom and by virtue of the fact that it is on level 3 there is no one at the front door so to speak.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However once you travel up to level 3 via the tiny wee elevator which has been inserted in the stair well, the welcome could not be warmer.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Rome

likes.disliked: — The limo they arranged for us from the airport seemed a bit pricey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In a word 'awesome'. We stayed in room 5 or 6 (I think?) It was a junior suite. Special cash rate was offered and was a very fair price for the room.
reviews.title: An Oasis in Rome

reviews.text: The room was really large for accommodation in Rome. The standard of cleanliness was excellent. The room was equipped with lovely classic furniture and was very well presented. The bathroom was large and included a Jacuzzi bathtub. Towels were white, fluffy and fresh. TV was great with full cable and a plethora of channels including bbc and cnn as well as sports channels. The room had excellent A/C and a mini bar and a small safe for valuables etc. It was really quiet too.
reviews.title: A wonderful stay and introduction to Italy

description: Quiet and exclusive, Residenza Cellini combines the timeless charm of its luxurious historical interiors with the functionality of the most modern and exclusive comforts to ensure a pleasant and restful stay.
